But of course, it won't be just like that. Check this list[1], most trusted and experienced campaign managers are there, you can check all of their works on their ANN thread, feel free to check their rules, their spreadsheet styles, their rates and requirements for every ranks in every campaign they managed, and etc.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4412712.0;topicseen

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Quote from: @sriyan on August 17, 2022, 06:40:20 AMI want to become a bounty manager. Are there any guidelines and sources to follow? Are there any particular procedures to follow in each step upon receiving a campaign for myself? Any help is highly appreciated. Thanks in advance. I would suggest you to first improve your post quality and grow your account's rank to a reasonable "Member" or higher. Without this basic workup, nobody is going to give you any importance.Beyond that you should start working as a trainee manager under some reputed manager who might also be looking for an "Apprentice/Intern" to reduce their own workload. They can help you get a job under their name and allow you to manage it while supervising it themselves.But this second stage is far from anything close for your account, so you need to work on your rank first. Having been a bounty spammer, very few people will take interest in you, but I am of the opinion that any person can outgrow their habits and become someone worthy, so good luck!

Thanks in advance.If you sincerely wish to be bounty manager you can achieve that, I am not a signature manager or a bounty manager but I have known how things work here to an extent. You need two things to get started. 1.Forum Requirements 2. Skills Requirements. In the forum requirements, you need to be able to make good posts, you need to be able to build your reputation. You can build your reputation by how longer you stay here, atleast rank up and be trusted by some forum members and then understand how other managers manages to succeed. In the skills requirements, you should be able to know how to work with spreadsheets, update enticing ANN threads and be able to know how to detect cheaters. Then you will be good to go.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: One of the important things about the campaign manager is the trust by the forum members and by the company, and therefore they do not need additional fees for renting an escrow party, which does not apply to the innovators.Therefore, you will need to gain trust and then compete with the existing campaign managers, which is not an easy task and may take you several years.

comments.author: spiker777
comments.body: Quote from: @sriyan on August 17, 2022, 06:40:20 AMI want to become a bounty manager. Are there any guidelines and sources to follow? Are there any particular procedures to follow in each step upon receiving a campaign for myself? Any help is highly appreciated. Thanks in advance.These are Few things that I would recommend you to do:1: Learn Spreadsheet skills (you need that to keep track of your signature . see how other managers are doing)2: Create your portfolio thread (see some example in services board)3: reach out to projects and offer them your services . give them reasonable rates and discounts so they hire you without having any past experience, you might consider giving 2, 3 services for free to kickstart your career.4: never cheat your community and campaign participants. and finish your work on time don't delay updates and payouts.
